course_description: Students in this course will identify obstacles to conducting robust scientific research, practice using current cutting-edge tools designed to overcome these obstacles by improving scientific practices and incentives, and critically evaluate these tools’ potential and limitations. Example tools we will investigate include shared pre-registration, experimental design, data management plans, meta-data standards, repositories, FAIR code, open source data processing pipelines, alternatives to scientific paper formats, alternative publishing agreements, citation audits, reformulated incentives for hiring and promotion, and more.
